question: Quellung reaction is seen with:
exp: Quellung reaction Capsular swelling due to serological reaction Pneumococcal Capsular antigen + Antibody causes Capsular swelling Note:- MC fadyean's reaction Done for bacillus anthracis capsule (polypeptide)

question: Babesiosis is most commonly transmitted by:
exp: o It is transmitted by ticks. o Babesiosis is caused by Babesia microti o It is an intraerythrocytic protozoa. o Half of all children and a quaer of previously healthy adults are asymptomatic with babesia infection. o M/C symptoms are fever, hemolytic anemia o A person infected with babesiosis gradually develops malaise, fatigue and fever. o Babesia maltese cross resembles plasmodium falciparum gametocyte arrangement. pig is intermediate host for tenia solium rats are the reservoir for rickettsia. Sand fly cause leshmaniasis (intermediate host)

question: Classical complement activated by:
exp: Antigen-antibody complex lead to activation of classical complement pathway. MAC - Membrane attack complex (C5 - C9) MAC-attack on Antigen & make pores and finally antigen killed Alternate Complement pathway - staing from C3QQ Note : - Compliment 1,4,2 is by passed Lectin pathway sta from C4 C1 will not be consumed in lectin pathway

question: Mark the false statement regarding testing of covid 19
exp: Testing of Covid 19 Most predominant method of diagnosis of Covid 19 is -PCR. First line screening assay: E gene assay. Confirmatory assay: RdRp (RNA-dependent RNA polymerase) gene assay. Additional confirmatory assay: N gene assay. CT features B/L and peripheral ground glass opacities Crazy paving pattern Lung consolidation
opa: Most predominant method of diagnosis of Covid 19 is -PCR
opb: First line screening assay: N gene assay
opd: Peripheral ground glass opacities on CT is the hallmark feature

question: Which parasite lives in bladder plexus?
exp: All the schistosomes live in venous plexus in the body of definitive host S. haematobium in urinary bladder S.mansoni in sigmodorectal region S. japonicum in ileocaecal region

question: Which of the following is the most likely cause in a case of granuloma?
exp: Various granulomatous diseases and their causitive agents. Tubeculosis -Mycobacterium tuberculosis Leprosy -Mycobacterium Leprae Syphilis -Treponema palidium Cat-scratch disease - Baonella henselae (Gram-negative bacillus) Crohn disease (inflammatory bowel disease)- Immune reaction against intestinal bacteria, possibly self antigens

question: Which one of the following is a major component in activation of the complement alternative pathway:
exp: - Alternate complement pathway Activators factor- Cobra venom , Properidin ,nephritic - C3b , Bb - C3 convease of alternate complement pathway - C5 - C9 is MAC (membrane attack complex) - C1,4,2 are not consumed in the alternate complement pathway
